text.text: Diictodon, a tiny therapsid from Zambia, South Africa, and China. A tiny burrower, Diictodon spent its days in burrows escaping predators like the gorgonopids it would've lived with. First discovered in 1991, it was described in 1993.
Diictodon was half a meter from nose to tail. It's considered to be one of the most effective herbivores of the Permian, spanning across much of Pangea. It made burrows up to 1.5 meters deep.
